About.title: About Me
About.subtitle: Clinical Psychologist specialized in evidence-based therapy and integral wellbeing
About.intro: I am a Clinical Psychologist with over 13 years of experience in mental health. Since my beginnings in Psychology, I have been passionate about understanding the complexity of the human mind and applying evidence-based strategies to support people in their personal development and wellbeing. Throughout my career, I have worked with individuals from different parts of the world, helping them face emotional, behavioral, and relational challenges.

experience.title: NHS Experience
experience.description: My professional experience includes a significant period at the UK's National Health Service (NHS), where I worked at the Merton Integrated Recovery Hub (IRH) and the Community Rehab Team. At Merton IRH, I was part of the recovery and support team, providing structured psychological interventions to patients and caregivers. Subsequently, in the Community Rehab Team, I worked on rehabilitating patients transitioning from long-term mental health units to the community, designing intervention plans to facilitate their integration.

approach.title: Therapeutic Approach
approach.description: My therapeutic approach is based on Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), combined with analytical psychology tools, always adapting to each person's individual needs. Through a collaborative process, I help my clients identify thought and behavior patterns that may be limiting their wellbeing, promoting practical strategies to generate meaningful and sustainable changes.

mission.title: My Mission
mission.description: My mission is to provide a safe and constructive space to explore challenges, discover opportunities, and ultimately promote positive changes. I invite you to learn more about my services and take the first step towards integral wellbeing, whether individually or within your company.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about my psychological services

q1.question: What issues do you help with?
q1.answer: I provide evidence-based treatment for anxiety, depression, OCD, emotional regulation difficulties, mood disorders, PTSD, psychosis, and more. I also offer counseling for personal growth, decision-making, and stress management.

q2.question: What is your approach to therapy?
q2.answer: My therapeutic approach is primarily Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), complemented by techniques from analytical psychology. Sessions are personalized to suit each client's specific needs and goals.

q3.question: How long does therapy take?
q3.answer: The length of therapy depends on the individual, their concerns, and their goals. Some people benefit from short-term therapy (a few months), while others may choose longer-term work for deeper self-exploration.

q4.question: Do you offer online sessions?
q4.answer: Yes, I provide online therapy for individuals worldwide. In-person sessions are available in Moscow, Russia.

q5.question: What happens in the first session?
q5.answer: The first session focuses on understanding your concerns, personal history, and therapy goals. Based on this, we develop a personalized plan to guide the process.

q6.question: How long are therapy sessions?
q6.answer: Sessions last 50 minutes, but I allow flexibility to extend them to 55 minutes if needed. This is based on the traditional "50-minute hour" used in therapy, ensuring enough time for discussion while allowing preparation for the next session.

q7.question: Is therapy confidential?
q7.answer: Yes, therapy is strictly confidential. However, there are legal and ethical exceptions, such as risk of harm to yourself or others, or when required by law.

q8.question: How do I schedule an appointment?
q8.answer: You can contact me via email or my website to book a session. I will respond as soon as possible to coordinate a suitable time.

q9.question: What is your cancellation and rescheduling policy?
q9.answer: Cancellations and reschedules must be made at least 12 hours in advance to avoid being charged. If you cancel within less than 12 hours, the full session fee will apply. Exceptions may be made in extraordinary situations.

q10.question: Can I have a trial session before committing to therapy?
q10.answer: Yes, I offer a 30-minute tryout session to help you determine if my approach is the right fit for you. This session allows you to ask questions and discuss your needs before committing to therapy.

q11.question: In which languages are sessions provided?
q11.answer: Sessions are provided in English and Spanish. For other languages, the use of an interpreter or AI tools can be discussed.

ProfessionalMemberships.title: Professional Memberships
